Title: Barnies 'Garden Gate' project
Description: We wish to use our garden beds at Barnies Community Hub to grow quick growing salad leaves, lettuces, radishes, spring onions, mint etc, as well as early and main crops of potatoes, onions, carrots etc. We wish to get some fresh salad produce out to as many people as we can, to help them stay well, and to help us to stay connected and show that we are working to support all of our local residents in Crewe St Barnabas Ward. Some salad produce has already started growing and this we can harvest reasonably quickly and put this into 'Barnies Salad and Veg Bags' for distribution to our most vulnerable participants and families, However, we need to replenish our beds with new plants, seeds, potatoes, plugs etc, and and increase crop amounts as much as we can to reach out to members of our local community.

Title: Wales Intermediary funder
Description: COVID19 - Emergency Response - This emergency funding will contribute towards the Voluntary Services Emergency Response Fund supporting communities across Wales with their response to and the impact of Coronavirus. This emergency funding will be distributed to groups through the existing grant giving mechanisms at a county level. Grants are currently enabling the voluntary sector in Wales to expand and adapt their services and activity during the COVID_19 pandemic. For example, food distribution to vulnerable people, increased counselling services for those that are struggling with poor mental health, befriending services adapting to online working, adapting and increasing domestic violence/women’s aid services, sharing knowledge and information with BME communities. TSSW will utilise this funding to help meet the demand they are currently dealing with. As the situation progresses, WCVA will consider how they move from crisis response to recovery funding.

Title: Covid-19 Accessible COVID-19 Information Project
Description: The Centre of Sign-Sight-Sound have received £59026 to provide support to people with sensory loss to enable them to access information about COVID-19 available services and other useful information such as finances in an accessible format such as British Sign Language. The project will cover Anglesey Gwynedd Conwy Denbighshire Flintshire and Wrexham but the accessible information formats will be available for use Wales wide. Mae'r Ganolfan Arwyddo Sain a Golwg wedi derbyn £59026 i ddarparu cefnogaeth i bobl â cholled synhwyraidd i'w galluogi i gael gafael ar wybodaeth am COVID-19 y gwasanaethau sydd ar gael a gwybodaeth ddefnyddiol arall fel arian mewn fformat hygyrch fel Iaith Arwyddion Prydain . Bydd y prosiect yn ymdrin â Ynys Môn Gwynedd Conwy Sir Ddinbych Sir y Fflint a Wrecsam ond bydd y fformatau gwybodaeth hygyrch ar gael i'w defnyddio ledled Cymru.

Title: Covid-19 Cefnogi Cymunedau Mon
Description: Medrwn Môn in partnership with the Isle of Anglesey County Council and Menter Môn will provide a strong workforce to support Local Support Teams who have established to support their communities through the COVID-19 pandemic. With a £59995 grant they will provide information and sharing of good practice as well as contribute to the increased demand in emergency supply of food essential items and well-being resources to the local community. Bydd Medrwn Môn mewn partneriaeth â Chyngor Sir Ynys Môn a Menter Môn yn darparu gweithlu cryf i gefnogi Timau Cymorth Lleol sydd wedi sefydlu i gefnogi eu cymunedau trwy'r pandemig COVID-19. Title: Covid-19 Llamau Coronavirus Response
Description: Llamau Ltd have been awarded £98988 to adapt and increase their essential services which support young people women and families at risk of homelessness who are facing additional challenges as a result of COVID-19. These services include supported accommodation family mediation domestic abuse outreach and a youth homeless helpline which will help mitigate the impact of the crisis upon their client group. Dyfarnwyd £98988 i Llamau Ltd i addasu a chynyddu eu gwasanaethau hanfodol sy'n cefnogi pobl ifanc menywod a theuluoedd sydd mewn perygl o fod yn ddigartref sy'n wynebu heriau ychwanegol o ganlyniad o COVID-19. Mae'r gwasanaethau hyn yn cynnwys llety â chymorth cyfryngu teuluol allgymorth cam-drin domestig a llinell gymorth digartrefedd ieuenctid a fydd yn helpu i liniaru effaith yr argyfwng ar eu grp cleientiaid.

Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 Art and Soul Tribe CIC
Description: Art and Soul Tribe CIC have received £93828 to launch an online mental health course (Mindset Mojo) along with a range of additional online courses such as digital skills movement and physical wellbeing creative art therapy and music tuition. They are also creating new and moving existing activities online such as nursery rhyme and storytelling sessions for mums and burlesque chair dancing for older people. A team of young volunteers Youth Tribe will undertake social activities such as delivering letters and pictures to isolated older people and online choirs. They plan to hold a community festival to bring together the community when social restrictions end. Mae Art and Soul Tribe CIC wedi derbyn £93828 i lansio cwrs iechyd meddwl ar-lein (Mindset Mojo) ynghyd ag ystod o gyrsiau ar-lein ychwanegol fel sgiliau digidol symud a lles corfforol therapi celf greadigol a hyfforddiant cerdd. Maent hefyd yn creu gweithgareddau newydd a theimladwy ar-lein fel hwiangerddi a sesiynau adrodd straeon i famau a dawnsio cadeiriau burlesque i bobl hn. Bydd tîm o wirfoddolwyr ifanc Youth Tribe yn ymgymryd â gweithgareddau cymdeithasol fel danfon llythyrau a lluniau i bobl hn ynysig a chorau ar-lein. Maent yn bwriadu cynnal gyl gymunedol i ddod â'r gymuned ynghyd pan ddaw cyfyngiadau cymdeithasol i ben.
Recipient Org:Name: Art and Soul Tribe CIC
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 Dewis Choice
Description: Aberystwyth University have received £99998 to support older victims-survivors of domestic abuse across Wales and address the co-existence of dementia and domestic violence the current legislative framework welfare benefits and pension entitlements for all forms of domestic abuse including: older male victims and LGBTQ older survivors. A forum will be set up for older survives and online training will be delivered to practitioners and organisations. This project will enable them to expand services Wales-wide expanding on the expertise and learning from the existing work. Mae Prifysgol Aberystwyth wedi derbyn £99998 i gefnogi dioddefwyr hn-goroeswyr cam-drin domestig ledled Cymru a mynd i’r afael â chydfodolaeth dementia a thrais domestig y fframwaith deddfwriaethol cyfredol lles budd-daliadau a hawliau pensiwn ar gyfer pob math o gam-drin domestig gan gynnwys: gwryw hn dioddefwyr a goroeswyr hn LGBTQ. Bydd fforwm yn cael ei sefydlu ar gyfer pobl hn sydd wedi goroesi a bydd hyfforddiant ar-lein yn cael ei ddarparu i ymarferwyr a sefydliadau. Bydd y prosiect hwn yn eu galluogi i ehangu gwasanaethau ledled Cymru gan ehangu ar yr arbenigedd a dysgu o'r gwaith presennol.
Recipient Org:Name: Prifysgol Aberystwyth / Aberystwyth University
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3

Title: Covid-19 Swansea Carers Out of Hours Helpline & Counselling project
Description: The Swansea Carers Centre will use £79229 funding to set up an out-of-hours helpline and counselling project. The project will provide an extra 20 hours a week of direct personalised one-to-one virtual/online support for carers. Carers are experiencing a much higher level of mental health issues including stress anxiety and depression as a direct result of the COVID-19 pandemic. This grant will help provide additional support for carers reduce their isolation and increase their friendship networks. Bydd Canolfan Gofalwyr Abertawe yn defnyddio grant o £79229 i sefydlu llinell gymorth a phrosiect cwnsela y tu allan i oriau. Bydd y prosiect yn darparu 20 awr ychwanegol yr wythnos o gymorth rhithiol/ar-lein personol un i un i ofalwyr. Mae gofalwyr yn profi lefel llawer uwch o faterion iechyd meddwl gan gynnwys straen pryder ac iselder ysbryd o ganlyniad uniongyrchol i'r pandemig COVID-19. Bydd y grant hwn yn helpu i ddarparu cefnogaeth ychwanegol i ofalwyr lleihau eu hynysrwydd a chynyddu eu rhwydweithiau cyfeillgarwch.

Title: Covid-19 NTC 'Virtual Centre'
Description: The Neuro Therapy Centre will develop a Virtual Centre to respond directly to members’ needs. The service will provide access to support for 156 individuals from North Wales affected by a neurological condition and their carers. It will enable them to continue to access therapies and services but in a different way. The project will help to keep people fit and mentally and physically healthy to help prevent a deterioration in their condition which in turn will help keep them out of hospital. Title: Covid-19 'Online Therapy & Support' project
Description: Bobath Children’s Therapy Centre Wales will use £99622 to deliver an Online Therapy Support project to help children with cerebral palsy and their families. The project will pilot the provision of its specialist services around physiotherapy occupational therapy speech and language therapy to children through on-line consultations in the homes of families including those currently shielding from Covid-19. The Online Therapy Support will also increase their capacity to offer over 450 consultations with children and families across Wales. Title: Covid-19 Get Creative (at home) Project
Description: The 3G Development Trust Ltd project has received £16474 to deliver a creative activities programme that aims to improve and maintain people’s mental health and well-being during and post Covid-19 crisis. They will provide direct home-based access to age-appropriate creative materials (bundles) together with user guidance including on-line support via the Get Creative Together Network. They will support 200-250 of the most as risk residents through this element of the project the grant will also be contributing towards income they have lost due to the lockdown. Mae prosiect 3G Development Trust Ltd wedi derbyn £16474 i ddarparu rhaglen gweithgareddau creadigol sy'n ceisio gwella a chynnal iechyd meddwl a lles pobl yn ystod ac ar ôl argyfwng Covid-19. Byddant yn darparu mynediad uniongyrchol yn y cartref i ddeunyddiau creadigol (bwndeli) sy'n briodol i'w hoedran ynghyd ag arweiniad i ddefnyddwyr gan gynnwys cefnogaeth ar-lein trwy'r Rhwydwaith Get Creative Together. Byddant yn cefnogi 200-250 o'r mwyaf fel preswylwyr risg trwy'r elfen hon o'r prosiect bydd y grant hefyd yn cyfrannu at incwm y maent wedi'i golli oherwydd y clo.
Recipient Org:Name: The 3G's Development Trust Ltd
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 St Peter's Church Community Hall
Description: Parochial Church Council of St. Peter's Church Machynlleth have received £18450 to help cover the costs of running the community facility while closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. As they have been closed they have been unable to generate an income. This funding will ensure that the community facility will be able to support their community once restrictions are lifted. Mae Cyngor Eglwys Plwyf Eglwys Sant Pedr Machynlleth wedi derbyn £18450 i helpu i dalu costau rhedeg y cyfleuster cymunedol wrth gau oherwydd pandemig COVID-19. Gan eu bod wedi cau nid ydynt wedi gallu cynhyrchu incwm. Bydd yr arian hwn yn sicrhau y bydd y cyfleuster cymunedol yn gallu cefnogi eu cymuned unwaith y bydd cyfyngiadau'n cael eu codi.
Recipient Org:Name: Parochial Church Council of St. Peter's Church Machynlleth
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19: Cyngor Dyled Tai/Housing Debt Advice
Description: Welsh Housing Aid Limited have received £93224 to deliver specialist housing debt advice to people in Swansea and Wrexham to help people to stay in their homeless and prevent homelessness. They will particularly target people who have suffered financially because of the COVID-19 pandemic due to decreased income levels job loss or job insecurity. Mae Welsh Housing Aid Limited wedi derbyn £93224 i ddarparu cyngor dyled tai arbenigol i bobl yn Abertawe a Wrecsam i helpu pobl i aros yn eu digartref ac atal digartrefedd. Byddant yn targedu pobl sydd wedi dioddef yn ariannol yn arbennig oherwydd y pandemig COVID-19 oherwydd lefelau incwm is colli swyddi neu ansicrwydd swydd.
Recipient Org:Name: Welsh Housing Aid Limited
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 Community Welfare Project
Description: Ateb Group Ltd will utilise their IT lending library and their Dot.e Digital Support Vehicle to provide a range of services remotely to support vulnerable people across Pembrokeshire. The grant will enable people to connect and communicate with family and friends and they will receive digital training and support. Additionally various street activities will be held across Pembrokeshire to reduce isolation and improve community cohesion whilst tenants will also be able to access financial advice and support. Bydd Ateb Group Ltd yn defnyddio eu llyfrgell fenthyca TG a'u Cerbyd Cymorth Digidol Dot.e i ddarparu ystod o wasanaethau o bell i gefnogi pobl agored i niwed ledled Sir Benfro. Bydd y grant yn galluogi pobl i gysylltu a chyfathrebu â theulu a ffrindiau a byddant yn derbyn hyfforddiant a chefnogaeth ddigidol. Yn ogystal cynhelir amryw weithgareddau stryd ledled Sir Benfro i leihau arwahanrwydd a gwella cydlyniant cymunedol tra bydd tenantiaid hefyd yn gallu cael gafael ar gyngor a chefnogaeth ariannol.
Recipient Org:Name: Ateb Group Ltd
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 Paul Sartori Hospice at Home Hands-on Care & Equipment
Description: Paul Sartori Foundation have received £92248 to meet an increased demand for end of life care in Pembrokeshire through the purchase of additional specialist equipment. The project will facilitate Hospital discharge for end of life patients freeing up beds in hospitals and providing support for vulnerable individuals who are at high risk from COVID-19. Mae Sefydliad Paul Sartori wedi derbyn £92248 i ateb y galw cynyddol am ofal diwedd oes yn Sir Benfro trwy brynu offer arbenigol ychwanegol. Bydd y prosiect yn hwyluso rhyddhau o'r ysbyty ar gyfer cleifion diwedd oes gan ryddhau gwelyau mewn ysbytai a darparu cefnogaeth i unigolion agored i niwed sydd â risg uchel o COVID-19.
Recipient Org:Name: Paul Sartori Foundation Limited
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 Digital Response - Covid 19
Description: Innovate Trust Ltd have received £39453 to use smart technologies to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on people with learning disabilities living in supported housing. The technologies and devices will allow participants to continue to be a part of their community and negate the effects of being socially isolated by improving both mental and physical health. Mae Innovate Trust Ltd wedi derbyn £39453 i ddefnyddio technolegau craff i liniaru effaith COVID-19 ar bobl ag anableddau dysgu sy'n byw mewn tai â chymorth. Bydd y technolegau a'r dyfeisiau'n caniatáu i gyfranogwyr barhau i fod yn rhan o'u cymuned a negyddu effeithiau cael eu hynysu'n gymdeithasol trwy wella iechyd meddwl a chorfforol.
Recipient Org:Name: Innovate Trust Ltd
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 Children and Young People's Wellbeing Workers for Pembroke and Swansea
Description: Hafan Cymru has received £76766 to provide support to children and young people in Haverfordwest and Swansea who are at an increased risk of both to becoming victims and witnessing domestic abuse during the COVID-19 pandemic. A package of support will include providing support remotely at first with face to face support in the longer term. This support will be delivered alongside Hafan Cymru's other housing related support projects. Mae Hafan Cymru wedi derbyn £76766 i ddarparu cefnogaeth i blant a phobl ifanc yn Hwlffordd ac Abertawe sydd mewn mwy o berygl o ddod yn ddioddefwyr a bod yn dyst i gam-drin domestig yn ystod y pandemig COVID-19. Bydd pecyn cymorth yn cynnwys darparu cefnogaeth o bell ar y dechrau gyda chefnogaeth wyneb yn wyneb yn y tymor hwy. Bydd y gefnogaeth hon yn cael ei darparu ochr yn ochr â phrosiectau cymorth eraill cysylltiedig â thai Hafan Cymru.

Title: Covid-19 The Virtual Community Hospice
Description: T Hafan Children's Hospice will provide crucial crisis care and community family support services to those families of life limited children most in need throughout South West and Mid Wales through a ‘virtual community hospice’. Family Support Practitioners and Complementary therapists will provide support and assistance to alleviate the additional issues caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. Bydd Hosbis Plant T Hafan yn darparu gwasanaethau gofal argyfwng a chymorth teulu cymunedol hanfodol i’r teuluoedd hynny o blant â chyfyngiadau bywyd mwyaf anghenus ledled De Gorllewin a Chanolbarth Cymru trwy ‘hosbis gymunedol rithiol’. Description: The Insole Court Trust in Cardiff has received £40580 to mitigate the financial impact of the COVID-19 pandemic ensuring that the venue will be able to reopen and continue to provide valuable space and activities for visitors and the local community. Title: Covid-19 Responding to Covid-19 and transforming support for autistic people
Description: The National Autistic Society has received £31850-to address the negative effect that the Covid-19 pandemic has had on the autistic community in Wales. The pandemic has had a serious effect on autistic people who are isolated from their support networks. The grant will enable The National Autistic Society to move their existing support networks online develop and maintain Wales-specific COVID-19 information for their website delivering three COVID-19 related live-streamed videos and increase the capacity of their Helpline. Mae'r Gymdeithas Awtistiaeth Genedlaethol wedi derbyn £31850-i fynd i'r afael â'r effaith negyddol y mae pandemig Covid-19 wedi'i chael ar y gymuned awtistig yng Nghymru. Mae'r pandemig wedi cael effaith ddifrifol ar bobl awtistig sydd wedi'u hynysu oddi wrth eu rhwydweithiau cymorth. Bydd y grant yn galluogi'r Gymdeithas Awtistiaeth Genedlaethol i symud eu rhwydweithiau cymorth presennol ar-lein datblygu a chynnal gwybodaeth COVID-19 sy'n benodol i Gymru ar gyfer eu gwefan gan gyflwyno tri fideo ffrydio byw cysylltiedig â COVID-19 a chynyddu capasiti eu Llinell Gymorth.
Recipient Org:Name: The National Autistic Society
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Covid-19 This Time
Description: Dyfed Archaeological Trust (DAT) will work with young people from challenging backgrounds and provide online activities and youth clubs to improve wellbeing throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. They will work closely with Carmarthenshire Youth Support and a variety of other partners to provide online bilingual activity resources a virtual youth club monthly crafting resource boxes and when possible hold a public exhibition of completed work to show how COVID-19 has impacted on young people’s lives. Bydd Ymddiriedolaeth Archeolegol Dyfed (DAT) yn gweithio gyda phobl ifanc o gefndiroedd heriol ac yn darparu gweithgareddau ar-lein a chlybiau ieuenctid i wella lles trwy gydol y pandemig COVID-19. Byddant yn gweithio'n agos gyda Chefnogaeth Ieuenctid Sir Gaerfyrddin ac amrywiaeth o bartneriaid eraill i ddarparu adnoddau gweithgaredd dwyieithog ar-lein clwb ieuenctid rhithwir blychau adnoddau crefftio misol a phan fydd hynny'n bosibl cynnal arddangosfa gyhoeddus o waith gorffenedig i ddangos sut mae COVID-19 wedi effeithio ar bywydau pobl ifanc.

Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Title: Dewis Choice Aberystwyth University Recovery Fundig
Description: COVID19 -We provide a service to older victim-survivors of domestic abuse in Wales . Funding is requested to a) develop our safety planning toolkit for older clients who are living with dementia and experiencing domestic abuse 2) to increase our capacity to deliver the intensive support for clients and their families during the Covid-19 period where there is a co-existence of dementia and domestic abuse. As a particularly high risk group, we would like to ensure that we can use our extensive experience and skills to safeguarding older victim-survivors. 3) To have the capacity to refine and expand our online training to include further in-depth information on the intersection between these two areas of vulnerability during a period of social distancing and lock-down. 4) to test and evaluate the safety planning toolkit and capture the contextual factors that facilitate a sense of a safer space and increase options for positive social connections. 5) Informed by the production of our LGBTQ films on domestic abuse in later life, we would like to use the partnerships we have developed to produce YouTube videos aimed at supporting older LGBTQ groups during this period of increased isolation. The funding would increase the capacity of staff to add a dementia strand to any short films aimed at different target audiences who want to learn more about older victim-survivors. Furthermore if the short YouTube films generated sufficient interest we would use our current online forums to create weekly chats aimed specifically to support different groups within LGBTQ communities. We are proposing an additional five- months funding to extend our service and to expand our learning on how to create safety tool-kits where domestic abuse and dementia co-exist. We will use the learning to offer a range of training tools online to front-line practitioners and volunteers on how to respond to the co-existence of dementia and domestic abuse during Covid-19. We will undertake a process and outcome evaluation of the intervention.
Recipient Org:Name: Aberystwyth University
Funding Org:Name: Comic Relief
Grant Programme:Title: COVID19 Recovery funding
Publisher:Name: Comic Relief

Title: Meeting needs of refugees and those with no recourse to public funds
Description:
COVID19 -The funding is requested to meet the changing needs of supporting our refugee and NRPF clients in this Covid 19 situation. From our needs assessment for refugees and asylum seekers carried out in May 2020 we have highlighted the following:
 employment ?ESOL related ESOL class - online IELTS classes with preparation for tests included
 support with furniture assembly, how to use with goods including practical classes this includes purchase of tools for assembly, training for refugee volunteers to assist. This will support our project with Save the Children.
 the increasing need for one to one support and the installation of safety measures such as perspex screen in an office during Covid 19 which will increase amount of support on offer.
Recipient Org:Name: Oasis Cardiff
Funding Org:Name: Comic Relief
Grant Programme:Title: COVID19 Recovery funding
Publisher:Name: Comic Relief

Title: Shelter Cymru Recovery Funding
Description: COVID19 -Funding is requested to help us meet essential operating expenditure for which we now have no income. People are worried about losing their jobs, their homes and keeping their families safe. We must continue to operate through the current crisis, and ensure that we?re strong enough for what comes next. The financial impact of Covid-19 on our charity means that we could see our reserves fall below our minimum level (3 month?s expenditure) by March 2021, unless we mitigate some of our losses. For the 6 month period of April 2020 ? September 2020, our loss is projected to be £362k. Over 12 months, this rises to £712k.
Recipient Org:Name: Shelter Cymru
Funding Org:Name: Comic Relief
Grant Programme:Title: COVID19 Recovery funding
Publisher:Name: Comic Relief

Title: SWAN Project -Stage 2
Description:
COVID19 -Looking forward to the next 6 months having reflected on our experience over the past 6-8 weeks, there are clear issues that we need to address to ensure the supply of vital specialist support can continue. These take into consideration the re-introduction of the SWAN evening outreach service and visits to parlours once appropriate and safe to do so.
 The key needs we have identified are:
 1. Additional full-time support worker for the SWAN project to ensure we can meet the demand increase and sustain sufficient staff resource for full service delivery should staffing level fluctuate due to Covid 19-related factors. 
  Salary + on costs + recruitment £12131
 2. IT equipment e.g. 10 tablets for women to use when in socially distanced one-to-one crisis appointments to access benefits, service information etc. £90 each x 10 £900 
 3. Emergency accommodation fund to utilise when women not able to return home due to Covid 19/ unable to self-isolate due to home setting and not able to access alternative accommodation via homelessness route.50 nights x £50 a night £2500 
 4. Deep cleaning of SWAN outreach van on a weekly basis in line with Covid 19 guidance. Minimum of once a week, but could require more often depending on infection rates amongst women supported.£100 a week x 26 weeks £2600 
 5. PPE supplies for evening outreach service ? disposable gloves, face masks, hand sanitisers, anti bac/antiviral wipes, disposable hand towels, cleaning materials. £2000
 6. Contribution to central administration cost of maintaining PPE supplies for SWAN outreach van ? 2 hours Office Manager + 1 hour Finance Manager x 26 weeks £1298 
 7. Contribution to CEO salary and on costs in recognition of weekly work carried out managing Covid 19 response ? 2 hours x 26 weeks £1139 
  
  TOTAL AMOUNT REQUESTED £22,568
Recipient Org:Name: Swansea Women's Aid
Funding Org:Name: Comic Relief
Grant Programme:Title: COVID19 Recovery funding
Publisher:Name: Comic Relief

Title: Older Women Living with and Surviving Domestic Abuse OWLS 2 Project
Description:
COVID19 -We are receiving an increased amount of calls for support for older women experiencing domestic abuse.
 This together with staff showing symptoms of Covid-19 (one member of staff is currently self isolating with symptoms which means our ability to deliver a service is halved). The funding would cover costs for a frontline support worker and relevant administration costs. We also require funding to cover costs for those unable to access benefits, access through Wifi and to have a desktop computer in both refuges. Some extra funding for travel by taxi to enable access to our safe houses as the trains and buses in Wales are still not working. We are also having to pay for deep cleaning and the costs of replacements for bedding as we are unable as in the past to rely on our donations of bedding due to the restrictions so require funds for this.
Recipient Org:Name: West Wales Domestic Abuse Services
Funding Org:Name: Comic Relief
Grant Programme:Title: COVID19 Recovery funding
Publisher:Name: Comic Relief
_recipient_name: WEST WALES DOMESTIC ABUSE SERVICE LTD

Title: Young men?s Online Support
Description:
COVID19 -We are increasingly concerned that the Covid 19 pandemic is having a detrimental impact on the mental health and recovery of the young people we support. The young people we support through our Comic Relief funding have all suffered or are at risk of suffering a psychotic episode. Around 1 in 100 people will develop a full psychotic episode in their lifetime. The vast majority (8 out of 10) will experience their first episode between the ages of 15 and 30. It affects men and women equally and seems to be more common in city areas and in some ethnic minority groups. 
 Psychosis can have an extremely damaging impact on a young person?s wellbeing and quality of life. It can affect their relationships with friends and family, and their ability to engage in education, training and employment. It also makes it very difficult to manage everyday tasks, like paying bills or rent. All of these problems are exacerbated by the lockdown and Covid-19 Crisis. There are significant personal, social and health impacts of psychosis when treatment and support is not effective. The lockdown has restricted our ability to provide effective support on a face to face basis. We are very worried about the long term impact of the disruption to the service on the people we support.
 Now that we are unable to provide face to face delivery, we are requesting funding to continue this work virtually. We will use funding to establish:
 - A custom-built section on our ?Clic? website. Clic offers a safe and secure place online to support each other, share experiences and build new relationships ? in either English or Welsh. The site also signposts people to useful information, contacts, resources and local services. The online community will include a safe, regulated supported forum where users can create a profile, connect with others, comment on a number of threads and make friends, thus reducing social isolation. Funding will contribute towards a dedicated section for young people to provide peer support; specialist time to produce relevant information and guidance for this cohort and increased staff time to allow for 24 hour moderation. 
 - Training to Young People and importantly, their carers or parents on how to keep active and social through digital inclusion skills.
 - PPE for limited cases of face to face contact if absolutely necessary and with strict adherence to social distancing guidance
Recipient Org:Name: Hafal
Funding Org:Name: Comic Relief
Grant Programme:Title: COVID19 Recovery funding
Publisher:Name: Comic Relief

They also support refugees and their families who have fled violence and abuse and have moved to Wales to settle free from harm.- They currently deliver a range of services to 6000 people across Wales, including refuges, domestic abuse service, child services and out reach projects. Title: Covid-19 Children and young people's mental health crisis and suicide response
Description: Eye to Eye Young People's Counselling Service will use a £57183 grant to provide support to improve and maintain the mental health of children young people their families and other community members and to manage the challenges to their mental health caused or exacerbated by the COVID-19 crisis. The project will provide additional staffing and resources to offer new and expanded support options. This will include education/advice for the prevention of mental ill health in children and young people additional support for children young people families and community members who support them and a community-based crisis response. The project will be delivered in Rhondda Cynon Taf with two key partners - Valley Kids and New Horizons. Title: Covid-19 A BRIDGE TO SAFETY for BAME Women
Description: BAWSO has received £99999 for their Bridge to Safety project which will recruit and train community advocates across Wales to reach out to BAME women experiencing domestic abuse who are further isolated in their community and in their homes because of the COVID-19 lockdown. The project will increase front-line word-of-mouth community-based opportunities for victims to access specialist support. It will raise awareness within the wider community and inform victims and those who have concerns about abuse that BAWSO support services are readily available and easily accessible. Title: Covid-19 Breaking through COVID isolation
Description: Stow Park Community will use £20103 funding to deliver weekly luncheon clubs and afternoon tea to the elderly and vulnerable groups in its community post COVID-19 lockdown. They will also provide bereavement support money management advice and mindfulness sessions. The project will rebuild the self-confidence of elderly and vulnerable people to start re-engaging with activities delivered at the community centre and therefore reduce anxiety and social isolation as well as supporting other members of the community with issues experienced as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Bydd Cymuned Stow Park yn defnyddio grant o £20103 i ddarparu clybiau cinio wythnosol a the prynhawn i'r grwpiau oedrannus a bregus yn y gymuned ar ôl cyfnod clo COVID-19. Byddant hefyd yn darparu cefnogaeth profedigaeth cyngor rheoli arian a sesiynau ymwybyddiaeth gofalgar. Bydd y prosiect yn ailadeiladu hunanhyder pobl oedrannus a bregus i ddechrau ailymgysylltu â gweithgareddau a ddarperir yn y ganolfan gymunedol ac felly'n lleihau pryder ac arwahanrwydd cymdeithasol yn ogystal â chefnogi aelodau eraill o'r gymuned gyda materion a brofir o ganlyniad i'r pandemig covid19.
Recipient Org:Name: Stow Park Community Centre
Funding Org:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund
Grant Programme:Title: People and Places 3
Publisher:Name: The National Lottery Community Fund

Description: Age Cymru Gwynedd a Môn will provide continued support to the older and vulnerable community as they are shielding from COVID-19 and into the future when restrictions are eased. The project will provide a community support service that will provide essentials and regular hot meals a telephone ‘keep in touch service’ and advice and information on challenges individuals are faced with. Bydd yn cyfrannu at les y gymuned wrth i unigrwydd ac arwahanrwydd gael ei ddyrchafu oherwydd COVID-19. Bydd £81500 dros 12 mis yn ariannu staffio.

Title: NTC Reopening Project
Description: 1. The Neuro Therapy Centre supports people who are vulnerable due to their long term, degenerative neurological condition for whom there is little statutory support in the region. We also support their Carers to care and maintain own physical health and mental wellbeing. 2. By taking into account social distancing and PPE requirements, the project will ensure the re-introduction of safe access to group physiotherapy, fitness & exercise, and Oxygen Therapy for individuals with neurological conditions on site at our premises in Saltney. This support will initially be by invitation only and will target the ongoing needs of those individuals who are most isolated and vulnerable, and who may not have engaged virtually due to physical, financial and/or IT and other barriers, in order to ensure their health and wellbeing needs are being met. 3. Grant funding will be used to contribute towards the cost of social distancing measures, PPE, IT and other operational requirements to ensure safe access to face-to-face services on-site in Saltney, in compliance with Government Guidance, as well as the NTC’s own Reopening Policy and Visitor Guidelines. 4. The focus of our project is the improved inclusion of ‘high’ and ‘moderate’ risk individuals with a long term, degenerative neurological condition, at a time when many are more vulnerable to infection and at risk of exclusion and isolation due to COVID-19, and we believe our preventative philosophy and transformational response to the pandemic closely aligns with the CCF COVID-19 Response Grants programme - Longer Term Emergency Phase focus of supporting organisations to adapt to the crisis. By taking this preventative approach, we want to reintroduce face-to-face exercise opportunities and other support required to enable them to manage their symptoms, limit further physical and mental deterioration due to their condition, and help them recover from the negative effects of the pandemic, whilst also ensuring they are safe and protected. This project will support improved health and wellbeing, and address the needs of the most isolated of our community many of whom will not have been out of their homes since lock-down started. 5. The impact of the pandemic has been significant on our income, which has reduced because of cancelled fundraising events, reduced subsidised contributions from members towards on-site face to face classes which have all ceased, and reduced revenue from our Community Café. Significant support has however been secured from the Steve Morgan Foundation to offset lost income for the period April to September 20, and other funding has been secured for the Emergency Phase 1 of the 'Virtual Centre' so our funding request does NOT include a support for financial stability.
Recipient Org:Name: Neuro Therapy Centre
Funding Org:Name: Cheshire Community Foundation
Grant Programme:Title: DCMS Covid-19 Response Ph 2
Publisher:Name: Cheshire Community Foundation

Title: Covid-19 Menter Cwm Gwendraeth Elli
Description: Menter Cwm Gwendraeth Elli Cyf temporarily closed their community hub and trading was paused on their social enterprises in March 2020 due to Covid-19 restrictions and as such are not receiving any income from these avenues. The applicant’s work aims to promote the Welsh language normalise the use of the Welsh language and promote the cultural heritage alongside a range of social enterprises such as a community hub café shop after-school club holiday club a translation and editing service and a monthly community paper.  £82400 over one year will fund the loss of income from community activities which would generally be used to meet organisational costs. Caeodd Menter Cwm Gwendraeth Elli Cyf dros dro eu canolfan gymunedol a chafodd masnachu ei oedi ar eu mentrau cymdeithasol ym mis Mawrth 2020 oherwydd cyfyngiadau Covid-19 ac felly nid ydynt yn cael unrhyw incwm o'r llwybrau hyn. Nod gwaith yr ymgeisydd yw hyrwyddo'r Gymraeg normaleiddio'r defnydd o'r Gymraeg a hyrwyddo'r dreftadaeth ddiwylliannol ochr yn ochr ag amrywiaeth o fentrau cymdeithasol megis canolfan gymunedol caffi siop clwb ar ôl ysgol clwb gwyliau gwasanaeth cyfieithu a golygu a phapur cymunedol misol. Title: Wellbeing through woodland activities
Description: Ecodyfi supports a greener economy and community in the Dyfi valley, Mid Wales. This project will deliver a series of Covid-safe group sessions in woodland, for wellbeing, drawing on the partnership and social prescribing relationships that have been established already within the previous pilot ‘Trywydd Iach / Outdoor Health’ project. The grant funding will pay the professional contracted Leaders and Assistants to deliver the sessions, and contribute towards the employment costs of ecodyfi’s proposed Trywydd Iach Project Officer, who will coordinate referrals, transport, procedures and monitoring. The project will improve the wellbeing of people with mental, emotional and physical health concerns, reduce the isolation that has sharpened this year, and improve people’s self-esteem through learning new skills and through being part of a supportive group.
Recipient Org:Name: Partneriaeth Eco Dyffryn Dyfi Eco Valley Partnership t/a ecodyfi
Funding Org:Name: Cheshire Community Foundation
Grant Programme:Title: The Assura Community Fund
Publisher:Name: Cheshire Community Foundation

Title: Cheshire East Money Advice Service
Description: Pennysmart CIC deliver money advice and training services to those in financial distress across CWAC and Crewe. The project will extend their Money Advice Helpline to Cheshire East area and provide casework support to an additional 65 of its most vulnerable households, in addition to training staff/volunteers to improve financial wellbeing amongst even more at risk families. Title: Third Sector Resilience Fund Phase 2
Description: COVID19 has had a detrimental impact on our organisation and business and continues to do so with a continuation of significant losses in our income streams across all business functions and avenues with particular concerns and a turn around required for our Soft Play Centre  which is purely customer base income driven.   As an organisation who have seen significant growth, impact and positivity over the last 5-years, a significant detrimental impact has been borne due to the COVID crisis which will jeopardise the entire organisation should survival funding not be sourced. We have seen an approximate 50% reduction in our income this year (£450k), however have been fortunate to have accessed a number or resources and lifelines to reduce the funding gap.  By accessing a variety of support mechanisms including furlough, phase-1 resilience funding and additional emergency funding we have been able to minimise the impact.  In addition to the funding obtained we have undertaken a whole organisational-restructure and have been working with staff encouraging where possible to find alternative employment.  From a pre-COVID staffing of 68 we currently have a staffing of 53.  It is unfortunate that we were in a position and required to issue three redundancy notices, however, two other staff secured roles elsewhere and 10 casual staff contracts were temporarily suspended however we are hopeful of their return when the current situation allows.  The actions we have taken as an organisation demonstrate how we are able to minimise organisational risk in challenging circumstances however we are still required to bridge a gap during a time where COVID is still affecting our ability to operate safely.  We are extremely confident we can ride the storm with financial support allowing us capacity and leeway to increase our customer numbers and gain the trust and confidence in returning.  Without the support, we will not have the cash flow to fulfill our financial obligations.    Taking this into account 85% of our request will be to support the organisational financial gap (approx 18% of our loss of revenue), having made realistic efficiency savings to date. This support will allow us to survive. The 15% of our request will allow us improve the facilities and investments we had made to our offer prior to COVID and help us get us back on the positive trajectory we were on pre March 2020.  We are confident that the implementation of the new climbing wall will generate additional revenue and increase our service users in FuZe
Recipient Org:Name: The Fern Partnership
Funding Org:Name: Wales Council for Voluntary Action
Grant Programme:Title: Third Sector Resilience Fund for Wales (COVID)
Publisher:Name: Wales Council for Voluntary Action

Title: Third Sector Resilience Fund Phase 2
Description: "Survive funding - We will directly use all funds to safeguard current jobs and protect access to our service during the first quarter of 2021. We have been forced to close our Café and reduce the service we offer whilst also being impacted by reduction in visitor numbers due to local and government restrictions - organisations who use our service being similarly affected. Our capacity for fundraising and donations has been greatly reduced which, with anticipated further lockdowns, puts us in a position of rapidly diminishing reserves – this combination poses a real threat to us being able to continue.
